reviews.review_text: I ve been craving Ethiopian food for months so when I saw this place was open and only minutes from downtown I was all in hoping for the best and the owner really came through for me! I ordered the veggie plate and my spouse ordered something with meat and we were both in awe of these dishes. So much food!!! It lasted us the sit down meal at the restaurant AND a late night snack at the hotel. Loved talking to the owner. He was so kind and hospitable to us. If we are ever in the area again, we will be back.

We live right around the corner and had been meaning to try this place out. What an experience. The food is authentic and I loved every part of it. Lots of flavour and eating with your hands made it all the better. Super friendly place

Really nice place with delicious authentic food and very nice staff. The menu came on one plate for the two of us for sharing the dishes. We had chicken curry & beef (not the most spicy one). There are great vegetarian options, too! Eating by hands with wrapping the main course into bread. Great taste! Be aware of the spice!   And the colour yellow of the curry, which stays at your fingers

Authentic flavour, cultural vibe, very friendly waiter and cook. The lamb was scrumptious! Love the share platter veggie combo with a meat dish added for a full array for flavours which was enough for three adults. A hidden gem for a legit Ethiopian meal!

Best Ethiopian food in Vancouver! The vibe is so good there as well, we went on a Saturday night and there was a superb guitarist and musician. The servers are friendly and the food is freaking delicious. Order the fish tibs, they are a mouth watering phenomenon. It s also great price for all the food you get. Amazing, can t wait to go again!

It s a hidden gem: 1. Hit with a subtle fragrance of spices as I entered 2. Friendly staff 3. Hypnotic traditional music 4. Calm vibe 5. Tasty organic Coffee 6. Ordered Kitbo and a soicy chicken dish 7. Big portion sizes 8. Pricing on point

I had been wanting to try Ethiopian food for a long time. I love a food culture that encourages eating with your fingers using some type of food as your main utensils and Injera fits the bill perfectly. I didnt do the ordering and am not totally sure what all we even got or what I was eating other than the bread but it was mostly all delicious. I think a favourite was a goat curry and a lentil dish. Also the chicken curry was unique and great

First time having Ethiopian food and it was super delicious! Owner was really friendly and attentive - gave us recommendations (ended up ordering the veggie platter and lamb). Portions were really big and we had lots left over :) will definitely come back!
Such good food. We got some lamb and beef, would definitely recommend.

We ordered the beef and veggie combo! Loved them both! I enjoyed the green beans the most. So much flavor and big portions, best part even better as left overs. Yummm. The chicken was good but it didn t stand out compared to the beef dish.

Pros: Super tasty food!!! I have tried over four things on the menu and none were a let down. Great for take out and dine in. Lovely friendly service, the real welcoming kind, not that get outta my face and stop asking me questions while I eat kind. Great prices and proper portions. Cons: The lighting inside is kind of dull. The restroom was messy.
I cant even begin to explain how great this place is! The food is 10/10!! Our waitress was extremely friendly and kept checking on us! I m coming back next time for sure
Very good, I tried chicken, lamb, and four vegetarian dishes. They have honey wine tej too, but its not on the menu, you have to ask. Enjoyed my dinner and drink!

We went there for lunch and had a lamb and a chicken dish. Both were very delicious! First time having Ethiopian food and definitely satisfied. Highly recommend it. Parking: Parking available right in front Wheelchair accessibility: Didnt notice any steps to get inside
Lega tibs and the vegetarian combo were absolutely amazing! I wish we lived closer because this would definitely be a regular dinner spot. The service was also wonderful!
Incredible authentic Ethiopian food. Great for sharing in large groups if you reserve ahead of time.
Amazing food, with friendly and helpful service.  Ethiopian food is an experience that you have to enjoy.  Eating this shared plate together was o much fun and delicious.

The best injera I ve ever had. Also, the best Ethiopian food in Vancouver city you won t regret. !!!! Cold juice & drinks, also there my favourite is doro tibs . Sooo filling and healthy ! Yum   may God bless this family, finances, and the restaurant and all their kitchen and the building and may it always be protected by Gods hands and blessed in Jesus name ! I will continue to purchase from here for my meals  as long as I am in the city. This beats pizza, why would anybody want pizza when you can have this, so much variety of food and you don t feel tired after you eat .. delicious truly .

You know how youve found a great place? The server takes real pride in describing the food! I love the sour bread, eating with hands and the flavours on the plate. Im a self professed foodie, and this was such a refreshing change! Try the vegetarian platter and the lamb!
First time here but not the last time . Amazing finger licking food :) . Had the lamb , chicken and vegetarian platter . What a little treasure !

I recently visited Axum and was blown away by the freshness of the food and the excellent customer service. From the moment I walked in, the staff were friendly and welcoming, and they made sure I had a great experience. The food was absolutely delicious - every bite was bursting with flavor and cooked to perfection. The portion sizes were generous and I left feeling completely satisfied. Overall, Axum is a hidden gem and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for delicious and authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The customer service was top-notch and the food was top-quality. Five stars all around!
Fun place and great food! Dont order everything, you will get full fast :)

There are Delicious Ethiopian traditional foods. Go and taste these delicious foods, then you will be a permanent customer. It found at the corner of Clark and East Hasting street. There is Good parking place.
Everything we had was soooooo delicious   Fish, beef and vegetables such a great combo. Also, such friendly service to go with it.
Brilliant experience having Ethiopian food. Get the Veg combo to get a taste of all the best vegetarian/vegan dishes

Amazing. Words cant describe how fantastic the people at this restaurant are. Went for food, as a birthday dinner for my fiance. They had a musician there who sang a personal birthday song to her, she got her drink on the house, and as we left she got given a gift. I already loved this place for making me feel like Im back home in Africa, but this experience was next level. It will be remembered all our lives.
Delicious Food. Veggie Combo (Split peas, Spinach,Lentils, Green beans) Tibz (Lamb), Fish Fry Vegetarian options: Good vegetarian options

I definitely recommend this place! Ive never tasted anything remotely close, I wasnt a fan of the flavor but I can definitely see why people would like it. The staff where amazing and super friendly, I especially loved eating with my hands!

Seriously great service. She clarified our preferences and tweaked a couple recipes for us. Also very generous portions. The vegetable combo and one other dish is more than enough for 2 people. So very affordable and delicious.

Loved it! It looks kinda sketchy from the parking lot, but go in and you will be warmly welcomed with traditional decor, lovely people, and authentic food. It wasn t as spicy as some Ethiopian I have had, but portions were very generous, tasty, and reasonably priced.
I love the food here but I have only ever tried the vegetarian options. Always excellent food and service tho
Hidden gem in the greater Vancouver area! Different and delicious, and the server was very kind

I had my wedding Saturday. The owner and the staff and the amazing DJ Sami. Made my event a dream come true. My husband and I and my friends are so happy to have wonderful food and beautiful experience. I highly recommend this place for everything and anything amazing amazing owner. Must try.
Great service, tasty food. Would highly recommend to try Ethiopian cuisine.

We were here with a group of seven and ordered two platters of both vegetarian and meat dishes. Each of the dishes offered was very tasty and the overall pricing was very fair. We will be happy to return on occasion.
The most authentic Ethiopian dish I have been able to find, tasted just like my grandma s cooking. I definitely coming back. Thank you

Ive eaten here 2 times, and each experience was awesome! Highly recommend the Vegetable platter, not very hot spicy but flavourful enough for any adventurous taste. Definitely planning on coming back! Patio dining available. They have a limited alcohol selection too.
We stopped by and we had some awesome service and awesome food at Axum with plenty left to take home!  Well 100% return!

Best Ethiopian food in vancouver! The owner is super nice and service is friendly and fastm the food is delicious and reasonably priced. Id recommend getting an extra injeera so you have some leftovers! The fish tips are immaculate!
Great food, friendly service and the best value.

Im Ethiopian so I usually eat my moms homemade food and thats the best to me but let me tell you this place is absolutely DELICIOUS! Easily the best Ethiopian food (very close second to moms home cookin)! If u want authentic Ethiopian food in Van, hit up this gem of a restaurant Also the music in the store slaps too
Its a gastronomic experience: The flavours, the spices, the atmosphere. The food even tastes better when you eat and share with friends.
great food and service. Lamb and fish are impeccable!
So delicious, especially the Kik Alicha!! Had been craving Ethiopian food for a very long time and it was just as good as I remember. Fun restaurant environment too.
Great food, good selection, friendly staff, big portion, great value!
Simply fabulous. The service was very friendly and prompt. Quite atmosphere. My friend and I took the waitresses suggestion and it was all delicious!

I wrote this review 7 years ago and it s still true. I love this place! Delicious,Inexpensive food. The staff are super friendly, service is good. I recommend eating in (they do take out as well) as they are better peppered than your home for the style of food. Unless you have giant plates for the bread! I almost always get take out but I am thrilled to have a tasty cheep source of vegan food!
We were guests of our familys Ethiopian sister. Dinner for my daughter and her new husband. Wonderful to have experts of the cuisine at our table. Will visit Axum again.
Always friendly. Service is excellent and the venue clean, and spacious.  Good price for what you get.  Venue is a bit on the chilly side
Absolutely mouthwatering! Great portions too!
Saturday night live music, yummy food!
Amazing food. Lovely restaurant owner and service. Definitely going back here!
Great value and food, enjoyed the authentic smells of incense, and sounds of Ethiopian traditional music completed with Afrobeats and Bongo. Vegetarian combo plate highly recommended!

My boss introduced me to this place and Im glad he did. Ive eaten here twice in a week I was craving it so bad! The love that goes into these dishes is incredible. The vegetarian options are delicious. The beautiful thing about these tasty dishes is that you can eat until you are stuffed and you still dont feel heavy afterwards.

The flavours! The textures! The hospitality! The price! Not only do I love sharing food with people I love, but I also love eating with my hands. (Could have used a few more napkins...) It was easy-going, and simple to order, the place was packed so it took a while to get our food (expected on a Saturday night), but whoa. WHOA. I cannot wait to go back and to take new friends. Axum was my first experience with Ethiopian food... And Im not sure if Ill ever try another place. I am totally in love with it here.

I like this one. Its quite big and spacious. They have a nice bathroom too. I like the cool Ethiopian music they play in the background as well. It seems to be popular with actual Ethiopians, which tells you something. Ive been here a few times and enjoy the food. Its hard to find a real restaurant in this area. This restaurant rules.

i ve never had ethiopian food before, but i can guarantee i ll be having it again very soon! it was delicious, the owner was very kind, attentive, and had great recommendations. LOVE the veggie combo. i ll definitely be back, thank you!

This is my go to Ethopian place in the city. They have great food and service. We have done a pick up,dine in and delivery and the food quality is consistent. We usually order the vegetarian platter and doro tibs(chicken) The food is delicious and extremely flavourful. Will highly recommend trying out this place.

Incredible food, generous portions, especially with their injera which means it is delicious and filling. Watch out for the new paper bags though, the handles can easily break if you try to lift the bag using only the handles, so put a hand underneath the bag as well to take most of the weight.

This is a great place for booking a group party. We were a group of 20 people and the staff took really good care of us. We order a buffet for the group. It is also great for individuals. The restaurant have a great selection of food on the menu. They also have s great selection of dishes that are vegetarians. They have live music every Friday night!

Had the vegetarian platter yesterday for lunch. Incredibly tasty. Absolutely loved the chance to select four veggie options. Just the right amount of rolled bread. The spicy lentils were just spicy enough. The green bean dish and the cabbage dish were my favourite. I ate every morsel. I will definitely come back. Parking is easy too.
Just got takeout from here for the first time.  Was delicious! We haven t had Ethiopian food for years but this really made us want to have it more frequently. Large portions and very flavourful.

Me and a friend decided to check this place out as we were waiting for a function near by and wanted to have some drinks. I was not disappointed; I tried a lamb dish and had some very reasonably priced drinks. I was very impressed, as this was my first time trying Ethiopian food. Will definitely be back.
Our familys favorite Ethiopian restaurant.  Really great vegetarian items.
Best vegan meal I ve ever had. Really enjoyed the spicy lentils, yellow split pea and cabbage dish! I m stuffed, enough for one very hungry person.
The most authentic Ethiopian restaurant I ve experienced. I am so glad we discovered this during our annual Vancouver trip!

One of my favorite restaurants. Its small and unassuming but the food is delicious and they have several vegetarian and vegan options. The veggie combo plate is two large meals worth of food for just $15. Delish!

Fabulous food and service. Owner and staff are wonderful people. If you want authentic Ethiopian food and atmosphere Axum restaurant is it . Their patio is great and open on weekends .A definite must.

Ive eaten here twice, and both times it has been perfect. The food is absolutely delicious, and very reasonably priced. The service is great, and theres a wonderful atmosphere later in the evening. Dont miss out on this place

I eat here at least once a month.  The food is flavorful, the atmosphere pleasant (they always have great Ethiopian music playing) , the portions are generous and the prices are very fair.  The staff are always extremely friendly too.  <3 Axum.

Dont let the exterior or decor fool you. The food here in probably the best Ethiopian in Vancouver. If youve never tried Ethiopian this is the best place to start as even my picky kids loved picking away at the injera.

Axum was a wonderful spot for Ethiopian food. The food was very flavorful, injera was great and a good portion. I forgot my soda but thats probably for the best. Definitely worth a visit. Thanks Axum for a delicious lunch! Will definitely be visiting again

Okay, I like to cook. So, when I go out for a meal I like to go for flavours that arent part of my repertoire. Served with plenty of bread (barley and teff flour) to eat and mop up with, we had three dishes (that meant leftovers!) for $60 including tip. Hostess/cook was charming, the food was great and Im sure heat lovers will leave satisfied.  Mild dishes as well and lots of vegetarian options. Loved it!
I love this place!!! Super friendly staff and the live music is so much fun! All of the dishes are amazing. Would recommend getting 1 veggie combo and 1 meat dish for 2 people.

Fantastic flavours and spices. The food is wonderful, although the speed at which it arrives to your table can be quite slow. Dont go if youre impatient and starving... the food is certainly worth waiting for but only if you can spare the time.

When we got there we noticed no food on tables but lots of customers. I guess they had just opened for the night. But we weren t disappointed at all by the food or service. They were super friendly and the food was very very good. We had the Goleb Goleb (butter warmed beef, so delicious) a lamb dish, four vegetable dishes and of course ingera (sour buckwheat flatbread, so good!) that you use to eat all the food. They didn t offer utensils, which is traditional, but they said they are certainly available on request. Overall a wonderful experience that I highly recommend.
Thanks for great and warm service. The food was amazingly delicious, tasty and plenty. I and my children enjoyed the food and the service. Thanks with great appreciation.

For variety and intensity of flavour, for the freshness if the injara (sourdough pancake made with teff flour), the gracious service, joy of a communal meal and cultural experience, Axum is my favourite place for a mid range meal. I can not remember a better restaurant experience in the last year. The lamb is a must for meat eaters! Wonderful vegetable dishes, too, and plenty of vegetarian options. Air conditioned.

Pretty sure weve been to most of the Ethiopian restaurants in East Van and this is for sure the best.  Never disappointed and run by a very friendly family.  Its definitely a place we regularly go.  And their prices are really reasonable too.
You can t get better Ethiopian food in the city. Bring a friend or 5! The more the better. Lamb tibs and the fish are impeccable

Delicious Ethiopian fare served by friendly owners & staff at an unassuming casual E.Hastings location. Everything was fresh, the flavors were exceptional, the prices very fair. Will definitely be back!

I have tried Ethiopian food in many western cities and this is by far the best one!! The food is absolutely delicious and they have plenty of vegetarian/vegan options available. The place is owned by a family, both of them are very nice.
Really good home style food for a great price. Owner is very nice as well. I usually order the veggie platter with one meat dish and am more than satisfied every time.
It is the most delicious experience I have had with friends in a long time! Every dish is good and perfect! I highly recommend it! We had the veggies combo and fish! and Beef! Enjoy!
I had a fantastic experience as a first timer. Everything was beautiful and had a lot of authentic cultural vibe to it. One must experience this place.

Delicious, I enjoy coming here every so often. The food tastes great. I always order the vegetable platter and usually one additional entree for two people, and we usually bring some food back. Would recommend checking this place out.
Always love the food at Axum, nice heat to their spicy dishes without sacrificing flavour, delicious injera. Friendly service.  We love their kitfo and lamb tibs.
Love this place. Family run. Great food. I just love the cabbage dish.  Dishes are typically shared, served on injera - a tart spongy bread - and eaten with your hands. Very fun.

This is my absolute favorite restaurant in Vancouver, BC. The owner is friendly, the music and food are wonderful. Ive had Ethiopian food in Toronto, NY and Vermont. I find this restaurant to serve the most delicious options if youre vegetarian or an omnivore. Someday, I hope they offer gluten-free injera for those of us who are gluten-free.

Really tasty food. Nice pace for a good visit while the food is cooked and to eat together as a group the food is all cooked fresh and served with plentiful injera. Nice live guitar music. Not fancy but we ll be back.
Lovely experience and very nice flavours
Awesome vegan Ethiopian food. The mushrooms and spinach are a must try. Live music! Although I m not sure exact schedule for music yet. Great space and great food for a great price.
Great vegetarian food, filling and delicious! I d highly recommend all the vegetarian options (except the spinach it wasn t my favourite), but the Kik Alicha and Miser Wot were fantastic.
Cozy atmosphere and ridiculously filling comfort food. One staff person running the whole thing (kitchen and front of house), but handling it great and giving a very just like home feeling.
Friendly owner and best kitfu in town
New Years Eve 2017 and the food was more than fabulous! Cannot say enough about the spices and tastes: each dish with its own flare. Highly recommended!
Great food, slow service.  Veggie combo is delicious; wish the injera was more sour
We had lunch here and it was delicious! friendly service and an authentic vibe. I will definitely be returning to try more of the menu. Thank you Axum!

Many people would walk right by and never consider it. Please give it a shot. It might feel a little strange at first but its worth the risk. Ill try to summarize. You get a large pan that is covered with Injera. This is kind of like a spongy pancake. In reality it is a sourdough flatbread. They also give you a side basket of for eating. This is why there are no forks and knives. The flatbread soaks up the flavors of the toppings you put on it. This is what you are ordering off the menu. Once it is done, the owner and cook will pour your toppings onto the pan and you can eat. Taking parts of the flatbread you scoop up the food. Its a great experience and is good for a group. Left overs are difficult so dont get to crazy your first time. My personal favorite is the lamb. Please give it a try. Its a worthy experience for any westerner.
First time experiencing Ethiopian food, definitely would recommend it! Great service, tasty food.
